Sync will create item+appraisal in Blender only when carrying over item+appraisal from VC. (And vice versa) If items were created in Blender without appraisals before sync was triggered, the sync process wonâ€™t create appraisals for those items. Sync explicitly ignores items without appraisals.
Sync intentionally ignores items without appraisals. It is by design

because before the sync there was no communication with VC. because before was manually from an CSV, once VC integration came, all the synchronization of blender items and VC items should have been created.
I wrote a PR to allow synchronisation of items, then it was scrapped, because we agreed that we will sync only appraisals.

And we agreed that all items that should be synced, should have appraisals. Thats how we got to the point where we allow null-values in appraisals. Sync process is agnostic of rule of creation of appraisals. It should stay that way and not create missing appraisals for items.
Im not saying that the algorithm itself should change, what Im saying it was supposed to be part of the sync feature when it was implemented.

text: Active policy LP44D29DC84 not populating when trying to file claim under correct policy.
Please change the priority of this ticket to high, I am unable to file a new manual claim under the correct policy and cannot assist customer or move forward with claim

@erin.flor The user has no active policies. The Aug 12, 2023-2024 term (LP7534F1D64) was non-renewed, so it `Expired` on Aug 12, 2024. The Aug 12, 2024-2025 renewal term (LP44D29DC84) therefore never activated, which is why it's in `Canceled Renewal` status.

Is the issue that the claim cannot be associated with the `Canceled Renewal` policy (LP44D29DC84)? I think this may be expected behavior since the policy was never active given the non-renewal of the prior term. cc @shai.gon.paz

@erin.flor Following up here. Since the date of loss was March 31, 2025, the user did not have an `Active` policy on the DOL. Their last `Active` policy was LP7534F1D64, which `Expired` on Aug 12, 2024 due to non-renewal. Shouldn't the claim just be denied due to no active policy on DOL?

@nathan.boettcher I have drafted a Denial letter and am waiting on the approval based on your last note! I was just confused based on the labels on the policy/user pages in Blender, and also that this policy LP44D29DC84 was not notated as nonrenewed in the customer's User Timeline

@erin.flor The way non-renewals work is that the renewal policy still gets generated in the system and triggers UW to review it. However, the non-renewal applies to the policy that's actually non-renewed, not the renewal policy. So, the non-renewed policy will show as `Expired` and have an alert showing `Non Renewed`. The renewal that never became active will just show `Canceled Renewal`.

@lior.eliyahu Its unrelated to VC integration, it's Blender's microservice architcture + transactions:
